In that Buddha's world, there is a bodhisattva named Incomparable. That Buddha has bestowed a prediction that he will soon attain supreme perfect enlightenment, and will be called the Buddha of Various Lights, Flowers, Jewels, Red Lotus, Golden Body, Universal Illumination, Adornment, Unceasing Eyes, Radiating Light, Illuminating the Ten Directions, World Banner King Buddha.

If there are good men and good women who, with faith, uphold and recite the names of that Buddha and the bodhisattva, these good men and good women will transcend as many eons as the dust motes in Jambudvipa, attain dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, and no evil or illness will befall their bodies.

Homage to Bodhisattva SarvabhavÄcalÄ
Homage to Bodhisattva SarvabuddharutacÄritra We take refuge in these and other innumerable and boundless great bodhisattva mahÄsattvas in the worlds of the ten directions.
We respectfully pay homage to the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and all the sages.

Homage to the pratyekabuddha Venu, homage to the pratyekabuddha JÃ±ÄnaÅ›arÄ«ra, homage to the pratyekabuddha ViÅ›eá¹£a, homage to the pratyekabuddha Kuá¹‡á¸akabodhi, homage to the pratyekabuddha VÄsudeva, homage to the pratyekabuddha Viá¹£aÅ›uddha, homage to the pratyekabuddha VimalakÄya, homage to the pratyekabuddha Puá¹‡ya, homage to the pratyekabuddha Ká¹›á¹£á¹‡a, homage to the pratyekabuddha Eka-ká¹›á¹£á¹‡a.
I take refuge in these and other innumerable pratyekabuddhas.
Having paid homage to the Three Jewels, I next repent.
As for repentance, it is fundamentally about changing past actions, cultivating future ones, extinguishing evil, and promoting goodness.
People live in the world, who can be without faults?
Even learners who lose mindfulness still give rise to afflictions. Arhats' habitual tendencies move their bodily and verbal actions. How much more so for ordinary beings who should have no faults?
But the wise ones are aware of it beforehand and can repent, while the foolish ones conceal it and let it grow. Therefore, they accumulate habits for a long time and have no hope of enlightenment.

If one is able to feel ashamed and reveal and repent, how can it be said that it is only for the sake of extinguishing offenses? It also increases immeasurable merit and establishes the wonderful fruit of the TathÄgata's nirvana.

If one wishes to practice this Dharma, one should first externally regulate one's appearance and revere the honored image, and internally arouse respectful thoughts and contemplate the Dharma. With utmost sincerity, give rise to two kinds of thoughts.
What are the two?

First, reflect on oneself, thinking that this body and life are difficult to preserve permanently. In one morning, they may be scattered and destroyed. One does not know when this body can be restored. If one does not encounter the buddhas and sages again, one may suddenly encounter evil friends and create various offenses, and again fall into deep pits and perilous paths;

Second, reflect on yourself and think, Although in this life I have encountered the TathÄgata's true Dharma and become a Buddha's disciple, the duty of a disciple is to inherit the holy lineage, purify body, speech, and mind, and abide in the good Dharma. Yet now we ourselves openly commit evil and then conceal it, saying that others do not know and that they do not see it. We hide it in our hearts and are arrogant without shame. This is truly the greatest foolishness and delusion under heaven.

Now there are presently the Buddhas of the ten directions, the bodhisattvas of the great earth, and the celestial immortals. How could they ever fail to see with their pure celestial eye the evil deeds we commit? Moreover, the spirits of the unseen world record merits and demerits without the slightest error.
As for those who commit offenses, after their lives end, the prison guards of the ox-headed demons record their spirits and present them to King Yama to discern right and wrong.

At that time, all the enemies will come to bear witness, each saying, You previously slaughtered me, roasting and boiling my body, or You previously stripped me of all my wealth and separated me from my relatives.
Now I have finally gotten you.
At that time, how could the witnesses dare to conceal anything? One can only willingly accept the retribution for past misfortunes.
As explained in the sutras, the hells do not unjustly punish people.

If in one's previous life one has committed various offenses and lost one's mind, all the appearances of the places where one committed evil deeds in one's lifetime will appear before one, each saying:
You previously committed such and such offenses in my presence. How can you conceal them now?
This means that there is no place to hide one's offenses.

Then King Yama will gnash his teeth and scold you, and hand you over to hell, where you will experience suffering for eons and years, with no way to escape. This matter is not far away, and is not related to others, but is precisely what I myself have created and am experiencing.

Although father and son are the closest of relatives, once the appointed time arrives, there is no one to take your place. We all have our own bodies and do not have many illnesses, so we should each strive to compete with our life and death, giving rise to great fear. When death is about to arrive, regret will be of no use. For this reason, the disciple with utmost sincerity takes refuge in the buddhas of the ten directions.

Homage to the Buddha of Pure Light Who Destroys Doubts in the East, Homage to the Buddha of Virtuous Freedom from Sorrow in the South, Homage to the Buddha of Flower Adornments and Spiritual Powers in the West, Homage to the Buddha of Pure Moon Palace in the North, Homage to the Buddha Who Destroys All Darkness in the Southeast, Homage to the Buddha Who Greatly Pities and Observes Sentient Beings in the Southwest, Homage to the Buddha Who Emits Light with the Fragrance of Incense in the Northwest, Homage to the Buddha of the Ocean of Immeasurable Merits in the Northeast, Homage to the Buddha Who Ends All Doubts Below, Homage to the Buddha Who Is Free from All Sorrow Above. I take refuge in the Three Jewels in the ten directions and throughout the realm of space, like this.
Disciples!

From beginningless time until today, accumulating ignorance, obscuring the mind and eyes, following the nature of afflictions to create the three periods of karmic offenses, either indulging in desire and attachment, giving rise to the affliction of greed, or being angry, resentful, and harboring harm, the affliction of delusion, or being arrogant and self-important, the affliction of contempt, doubting the right path and being undecided, the affliction of wrong views denying cause and effect, not recognizing conditioned arising and clinging to a self, the affliction of being confused about the three periods and grasping at annihilation and permanence, associating with evil dharmas and giving rise to the affliction of grasping at views, mistakenly following false teachers and creating the affliction of grasping at precepts, up to the affliction of horizontally calculating the four false views, today we sincerely take refuge and repent.

From beginningless time until today, accumulating ignorance, obscuring the mind and eyes, following the nature of afflictions to create offenses of the three times, either indulging in desire and attachment, giving rise to the affliction of greed, or being angry and resentful, harboring the affliction of harm, or being confused and deluded, not understanding the affliction, or being arrogant and self-important, despising others due to the affliction, doubting the right path and being indecisive due to the affliction, slandering the non-existence of cause and effect with the affliction of wrong views, not recognizing conditioned arising and clinging to self due to the affliction, being confused about the three times and grasping at annihilationism and eternalism due to the affliction, associating with evil dharmas and giving rise to the affliction of grasping at views, deviating and receiving from false teachers and creating the affliction of grasping at precepts, and even up to the affliction of horizontally calculating the four propositions equally, today we sincerely take refuge and repent.
The affliction of being unable to bear, the affliction of laziness and procrastination, the affliction of mental agitation and discursive thoughts,

The affliction of being confused upon encountering objects and lacking understanding, the affliction of giving rise to self and other in accordance with the eight worldly dharmas,ğŸ”½The affliction of flattery and insincerity, the affliction of being difficult to approach and unharmonious,
The affliction of being easily angered and difficult to please, the affliction of harboring resentment, the affliction of jealousy, stinginess, and stubbornness,
The affliction of being violent, harmful, deceitful, and poisonous, the affliction of contradicting the two truths and clinging to characteristics,

The affliction of giving rise to inverted views regarding suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, the affliction of following birth and death and the twelve links of dependent origination,
The affliction of turning without beginning or end, the affliction of the endless sands of afflictions in the ground of nescience, the affliction of giving rise to the four abodes
And constructing the fruit of suffering in the three realms, such afflictions are immeasurable and boundless,
Disturbing the sages and the six destinies and four forms of birth. Today, I confess and reveal this to the Buddhas, the supreme Dharma,
And the noble assembly. I take refuge and repent.

May the disciples, by the merit of repenting of all afflictions such as greed, anger, and delusion, wish to be born in life after life, to break the banner of arrogance, to exhaust the water of desire, to extinguish the fire of anger, to destroy the darkness of delusion, to uproot the basis of doubt, to tear apart the net of views, to deeply recognize the three realms as if they were a prison, the four elements as poisonous snakes, the five skandhas as enemies, the six sense bases as an empty village, the love of deceit as good, to cultivate the eightfold noble path, to cut off the source of ignorance, to head straight for nirvana without rest, with the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment corresponding moment by moment, and the ten perfections always present.
, looking around from the top of the high tower, he saw the criminals each entering through the four gates, crying out in front of Baoda.
They entered the iron carriage, iron ox, iron donkey, and iron horse, which were the four small hells in front of the one great hell.
What is called the iron carriage, iron horse, iron ox, and iron donkey hell?

This hell is fifteen yojanas in circumference, with iron walls one yojana high. Fierce flames blaze and burn the iron chariots, which are ablaze and burning fiercely. There are iron bulls whose bodies are also burning, with horns, head, hair, and tail all like sharp blades, and flames burning in their hair, with smoke and flames coming out together;
The iron horses have hair and manes like sharp blades, and flames burn in their hair and manes, with smoke and flames coming out together;
The iron donkeys are also like this.
In that hell there are iron pikes, sharp like blades, and iron spikes scattered all over the ground, the spikes burning with flames fiercer than before.
At that time, in the northern gate there were five hundred monks, crying out in distress with fire coming out of their mouths and eyes, crying out thus:
Why do I now suffer such pain?
The jailers, yakshas, and horse-headed rakshasas grabbed three-pronged iron forks with their hands, struck them from behind, and came out from their chests.
There are also iron ropes that come and bind the arms, the ropes on fire burning the arms of the sinners.
There are also iron shackles that shackle the throats of the sinners, the shackles having eight edges sharp as blades, the smoke and fire fierce and blazing, burning the necks of the sinners.

At that time, the sinners roll around on the ground and refuse to move forward. The horse-headed rÄká¹£asa takes an iron cudgel in his hand and strikes at their heads, the bodies of the sinners shattered like fine dust.

There are also hungry ghosts that come to eat their flesh, and hungry dogs that come to drink their blood. The horse-headed rÄká¹£asa kicks the ground and says live, and the sinners immediately come back to life.
At that time, the iron ox bellows and runs about, its bellows coming towards the sinners, the sinners pressed and rolled around on the ground.
The horse-headed rÄká¹£asa takes an iron pitchfork in his hand and spears them onto the cart.
The sinners struggle and fall back onto the ox, the ox's fur bristling as it enters through the belly and emerges from the back.

The ox kicked again, and the criminal fell on the horse's back. The horse's mane was like sharp blades, and as the horse shook its tail, the criminal's body was shredded, but he revived in an instant.ğŸ”½Then the iron horse raised its legs and kicked the criminal's body to dust, but he revived in an instant.
Again, the criminal rode the iron donkey, which then kicked and threw him to the ground. The donkey became very angry and kicked him to death in an instant, but he revived in an instant.
In a single day and night, he suffered countless punishments.
Baota asked the horse-headed rakshasa:
Why are these monks like this?
The rakshasa replied:

These monks received the Buddha's precepts, but they only cared about the present and did not consider the future. They violated the pure precepts and intentionally committed evil deeds by keeping impure things, riding carriages, horses, and donkeys for business, and had no kind heart. They did not protect their dignified demeanor and accepted people's offerings.
Because of these evil causes and conditions, they fell into this hell for hundreds of thousands of kalpas.
Even if they are born as humans, their bodies will be incomplete, deaf, blind, mute, not seeing the Three Jewels, and not hearing the true Dharma.
Hearing this, Baodala wept and sighed:
How can a monk transcend the three realms?
How can evil karma lead to such suffering?
Baodala then left.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
